channel.title: machine learning on Debashish Sahu
channel.description: Recent content in machine learning on Debashish Sahu

item.title: Using TensorFlowJS (Machine Learning) for Speech Recognition on ESP8266
item.description: Use TensorFlowJS via WebAudio API and WebGL GPU acceleration on Browser to recognize “keywords”. In our case, without retraining “UP” turns on LED and “DOWN” turns it off. FFT on ESP32 GitHub: debsahu/SpeechRecognitionTensorFlowJS Speech Recognition on Browser, AsyncWebServer served on ESP8266 to control LED_BUILTIN/GPIO16 Uses WebAudio API and WebGL GPU acceleration = speech recognition is done on the browser http:// requests for microphone is blocked for chrome, use firefox instead tf.

item.title: Stock Prediction on Python Using Machine Learning (NARX)
item.description: This video is a collaboration with my wife who does “machine learning on big data” for a living. Here is a naive attempt at predicting a particular stock’s price and displaying it on a ESP8266. This algorithm is not the best one out there, but what is being shown here is the ability to port it elsewhere and easily integrate these complex models with micro-controllers (ESP8266) and other devices.
